Even by his own account, he inserted a portion from a different speach As for the clip preceding the Denver speech, when Heston proclaims "from my cold dead hands," this appears as Heston is being introduced in narration. It is Heston's most well-recognized NRA image – hoisting the rifle overhead as he makes his proclamation, as he has done at virtually every political appearance on behalf of the NRA (before and since Columbine). I have merely re-broadcast an image supplied to us by a Denver TV station, an image which the NRA has itself crafted for the media, or, as one article put it, "the mantra of dedicated gun owners" which they "wear on T-shirts, stamp it on the outside of envelopes, e-mail it on the Internet and sometimes shout it over the phone.".  THe NRA had no choice. They are required to hold a meeting of voting members each year under new yorks laws for non-profit orgganisations. They cannot change the location of the meeting without giving their memebrs 10 days notice (Also the law). The columbine shootings took place 11 days before the meeting was scheduled to take place. By the time the NRA was able to get everybody together to discuss options, they were inside the 10 day timetable.
